TopicTitle: Official Weekly (Biweekly?) Spacecraft Exchange Showcase Thread

Articles.Content:
How......How........how.....

Keep in mind i built this thing in about .18, and it not only still works but it's a monster. 1800 parts, room for millions of missiles and/or capable of carrying an interplanetarry ship on its back. Or a mobile airfield.

Keep in mind i built this thing in about .18, and it not only still works but it's a monster. 1800 parts, room for millions of missiles and/or capable of carrying an interplanetarry ship on its back. Or a mobile airfield.

Still too small for my liking.

I would prefer sticking to the comedic nature myself. It is what KSP is all about and I enjoy it. I don't think you should be as critical as Jim suggests but some more in-depth reviewing would be nice at the end of the video. Like a short recap summarizing the strengths and weaknesses of the crafts.

I was only pointing out that in the OP he wrote down a few review criteria that he didn't put into practice in the video. Personally I don't want my hard work just blown up on screen for the hell of it. I do that myself very well thank you.
love it wen will the next be uploaded?

All right, the Ratte is ready for download!

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/51571-P-1000-Ratte-%28Back-and-bigger-than-ever%21%29
This I want to see. Maybe turn off destructible facilities before loading this monster.

This I want to see. Maybe turn off destructible facilities before loading this monster.

Yeah, and the turn rate is so poor, it's not exactly a tight quarters machine.

I was fairly angry when my Mega-Truck was attacked with no means to defend itself.

In these hard times giant trucks should have the right to self defense. So I have made something new.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/112061-WIP-AKV-200-Missile-Tank

It basically is controlled the same way as the old mega-truck.

The firing system is pretty simple. Just aim the turret at the target and shoot.

Hot-keys 1-4 fire each of the 4 missiles individually.

AKV-200 Missile Tank Update

It has new more durable axles and wheels at the cost of them not being SAS powered. The Tank now relies on Jet thrust.

It has better and prettier armor as well. The Turret is more durable too.

Small part count reduction

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/112061-WIP-AKV-200-Missile-Tank

Added new wheels not visible in the picture.

AKV-200 Missile Tank Update

http://i.imgur.com/RyHGOxb.jpg

It has new more durable axles and wheels at the cost of them not being SAS powered. The Tank now relies on Jet thrust.

It has better and prettier armor as well. The Turret is more durable too.

Takes a really long time for him to make the video. Since I love the space shuttle I want to give you a critical review ASAP.

So here it is.

Needs a lot more amour. Easily susceptible to Russian sabotage.

I'd like to see how this would be handled:

958 parts, 150 tons, and enough firepower to level all of KSC.

(It does feature action groups, and is controlled via two hidden probe cores in the center of the ship's spine.)

Alright guys, ima start a recording session tomorrow!

A word of advice, some things may not be serious, however, others will be. *cough*

I suggest you do some off-screen testing of my AKV-200 first. Version 3 is less parts but the lights button doesn't work and the wheels break at high speed. It needs some good refining. Version 2 seems more reliable in those aspects but is about 50 parts more.

I can't wait

It is on its way to being one of the best KSP video series.

Yours can be the one that people can actually use. His can be the one that's slightly cooler but is also generally no fun because it takes an hour to fire.

Considering i saw no traces of the car in the editing bits(its perfectly understandable, cars aren't really intresting to a good amount of people)

I decided to bring something with a bit more "Bang"

Shipped straight from Trussia!

User's manual

First Rocket:

Avoid turning too tightly

Brake(slowly)

Control the first rocket(Left one)

Hold S before pressing Spacebar

Press Spacebar while holding S

Stop holding S after the entire rocket passes the front wheels that are in the air

Control the rocket to hit your target

Second Rocket:

Repeat steps 1-3 of First Rocket

Hold S and D before pressing spacebar

Press Spacebar while holding S and D

Stop holding S and D after the entire rocket passes the front wheels that are in the air

Repeat the last step of First Rocket

Download: Buy now at: http://www./download/2gr43jgndcgj4tb/ZRK_2011_Cicle_the_Missile_Launcher.zip

EDIT: Old store sells outdated Missile launchers, get some from this new one:

http://www./download/wdo3tzaqc85eebr/ZRK+2011+Circle+2.0.zip
